params.text:
1. Land Preparation

For open field planting:

  1. Plow and harrow the land twice to ensure that the soil is well pulverized. 

  2. Construct canals to provide drainage and remove excess water. Basally apply organic fertilizers and/or fully decomposed manure by spreading and incorporating in the soil during land preparation.

 

2. Seedling Production and Planting

In seedling production and planting, the following are recommended: 

  1. Sow 3 to 4 seeds in polyethylene bags. 

  2. Cover with fine soil. Seeds germinate 15 to 20 days after sowing. 

  3. Thin out to two seedlings per polybag. 

  4. Water daily and regularly. 

  5. Transplant seedlings when they are about 6 inches high or 2 months old. 

  6. Plant at a distance of 2.5m x 1.6m to 3.0m x 2.0m.

  7. For hybrid varieties, plant one seedling per hill. For open pollinated varieties (OPV), plant three seedlings per hill. 

  8. Retain one (1) vigorous female or hermaphrodite plant per hill during flowering stage and discard the rest. 

 

3. Water Management

When watering papaya plants, consider the following:   

  • Water during the early stages of growth and periods of prolonged drought. 

  • Do supplemental irrigation to avoid growth retardation, flower abortion and dropping of young fruits. 

  • Water daily newly transplanted seedlings until they become fully established.

  • Irrigate young papaya seedlings once a week.

  • Water bearing trees every week during dry periods. 

  • Hill up to improve drainage during rainy season. 

 

4. Nutrient Management

  • The table below is the general fertilizer recommendation for papaya. The use of foliar fertilizer can be done depending on the choice of the grower.

Time Amount/Tree Tyoe of Fertilizer
At planting 50 g(1/2 handful) Ammonium Sulfate
1st month 50 g(1/2 handful) Ammonium Sulfate
2nd month 100 g(1 handful) Complete
3rd month 100 g(1 handful) Complete
4th month 100 g(1 handful) Complete
5th month 100 g(1 handful) Complete
6th month 100 g(1handful) Complete
Every two months 100 g(1 handful) Complete
